text: The 11th César Awards ceremony, presented by the Académie des Arts et Techniques du Cinéma, honoured the best French films of 1985 and took place on 22 February 1986 at the Palais des Congrès in Paris. The ceremony was chaired by Madeleine Renaud and Jean-Louis Barrault and hosted by Michel Drucker. Three Men and a Cradle won the award for Best Film. ==Winners and nominees== The winners are highlighted in bold: *Best Film: Three Men and a Cradle, directed by Coline Serreau L'Effrontée, directed by Claude Miller Péril en la demeure, directed by Michel Deville Sans toit ni loi, directed by Agnès Varda Subway, directed by Luc Besson *Best Foreign Film: The Purple Rose of Cairo, directed by
